revised_title: Ultrastructure of Thalamic Nuclei and Afferent Fibers in the Monkey
tldr: This study examines the ultrastructure of the ventrolateral and centre-median nuclei of the thalamus in the monkey, focusing on the dendrites, somatic spines, and synaptic profiles. The research also investigates the mode of termination of afferent fibers from the motor cortex, globus pallidus, and deep cerebellar nuclei. The findings reveal similarities and differences in the ultrastructure of the two nuclei and provide insights into their synaptic organization and connectivity.
